attributes.action: Roll back the increasing state surveillance of ordinary law-abiding people
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As some of you may know from 1st October it will be mandatory for all telecoms companies to keep records of all the phone calls we make for up to one year.  Though this won't include the content it will include who we called & our locations.  From 2009 this data will also include our e-mails and the websites we visit.  A whole range of officials (not just police and security services) will have access to this information.  These include local councils, NHS trusts, the Department for Transport & the Food Standards Agency.  There was no parliamentary vote on this matter; it was introduced to bring us into line with the European Data Retention Directive, as the government are legally entitled to do.
